cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles SSW of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north this morning, then turning northeast and accelerating across the southeastern United States and expected to exit off the Mid-Atlantic coast Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle/Big Bend near Panama City – Apalachicola

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical Storm Warning north of Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of FL and AL, then inland GA/SC/NC and the Mid-Atlantic coastline as the system races northeastward
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25-35 kt possible late Thursday night into Friday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge possible in upper Chesapeake Bay (generally <2 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain Thursday night–Friday with localized higher amounts and brief flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado risk in rain bands as the system passes south and east of the port
